moves.1. d4:
I thought I should start trying to learn the Queen's pawn openings. Not really sure what to expect here. 

I used Fritz 6 light to help analyze the game
moves.1... d5 2. c4 Nf6 3. cxd5 Nxd5: Another option was 3... Qxd5 4. Nc3 Qa5
moves.4... e6 5. e4 Bb4+ 6. Bd2 Bxd2+ 7. Qxd2: too passive, should have played something like Rfd1 and worked to open a file
moves.16... Qe7 17. Rfe1 Nh5 18. g3:
Again too passive. d5 would've been better continued by 18... Ba8 19. Bb5 Rfd8 20. Red1

taking d5 with the epawn loses a piece when I recapture with my pawn
moves.23. Nh2 e5 24. Nd5: Ng4 was stronger - likely to win the e-pawn after Qe6 25. Rbd1 Bc6 26. Bxc6 Qxc6 27. Nxe5
moves.24... Bxd5 25. Qxd5 Qe6 26. Red1: I probably should've traded queens here. Fritz gives the trade a  /=.59 where my move Red1 offers a return to equality
moves.26... f5: This was a blunder I didn't take advantage of - just didn't see 27. Qxe6  Nxe6 28. Bc4 Nf6 (or Nhg7) 29. Rxb6 with a clear advantage for white
moves.27. Bc4 Ng7 28. Rbc1 Qxd5 29. Rxd5 Kh8 3: Probably should've taken the pawn on a4
moves.31. Rxe5 Nc3 32. Rd6 Ne4 33. Rxb6 Rxd7 3: Much stronger would've been Nxf3 - Black cannot take back with his Rook without losing material. for example. 36... Rxf3 37. Ra8  Ne8 (forced) 38. Rxe8  Kg7 39. Rxe4
moves.36... Nd2: Not the best - Rb2 traps the Knight - Ng5 would've been better
moves.37. Nxf3: In the game I saw this as forcing Black to play 37... Nxf3  38.Bxf3 Rxf3 39.Ra8  Ne8 40.Rxe8  - which is what happened. I did not see Rxd5 as a response. I also did not see Rb2 trapping the Knight
moves.37... Nxf3+: 37... Rxd5 38. Rxd5 Nxf3  would've won a bishop and a Knight for a rook
moves.38. Bxf3 Rxf3 39. Ra8+ Ne8 40. Rxe8+ Kg7: I had considered trading rooks, but didn't like it as much. Fritz gave it a slight advantage to a5. I think I wanted to maintain tension and thought if you were to trade after taking back with my pawn and then moving my rook to the 6th rank I would have a good chance to promote
moves.42... h5 43. g5: I also could've played 43.Rg8  Kxg8 44. Rxf6
Rf5  would've been better. It may have even led to a draw if 50. Kg2 Rd3 then if if White takes the pawn on h5 its a draw after Rxf2  and then the checks are perpetual.

Otherwise I think this pawn check sealed the deal and put Black in a losing end game
moves.52... Rf5+ 53. Kg2 Kg7 54. a7 Rg5+: Either or on the next move or this one, Rd8 would've have given Black a better chance
moves.55. Kf1 Ra4 56. Rba6: Black resigns as the promotion is now inevitable

gameName: I just keep coming back for more
